description:
Enjoy the centuries-old culinary traditions with our Slow Cooking. 

We cook in clay pots, in a brick oven, for many hours. 
Our recipes blend the culinary practices of North Africa & the Balkans, reflecting our family's origins. 

Slow Cooking demands time, and we kindly request dinner reservations before 12:00 pm on the same day, ensuring every dish is perfectly prepared for our esteemed guests. 

Our approach infuses every pot with a personal touch, enhancing its journey in the oven. This method enables us to efficiently manage food supplies, achieving zero food waste, and grants us the privilege of daily handpicking the finest locally-sourced vegetables. Apart from our Vegetarian options, we proudly present our own fresh catch for the  Deep Sea Specials, as well as a selection of Beef, Chicken, Duck, and Turkey, sourced from a trusted local farm. 
Embracing seasonal availability, we are constantly challenged, and inspired to refine our recipes and techniques.
Book via WhatsApp.

description: If you are looking for a taste of real Egyptian cuisine, look no further than El-Kababgy restaurant in Luxor. This cozy place offers a variety of dishes that are cooked with fresh ingredients and traditional spices. You can enjoy Mashi, a stuffed vegetable dish, tagines, slow-cooked stews with meat and vegetables, grill specialties such as Shish Tawook, chicken skewers, Kebab and Kofta, minced meat patties, and more. Don't miss the Hammam, pigeon with rice, Fatta, bread with meat and sauce, Mesaka'a, baked eggplant with cheese, and Feteer, flaky pastry with sweet or savory fillings. All this while admiring the stunning view of the Nile and the West Bank of Luxor from the restaurant's terrace. El-Kababgy is a must-visit for anyone who loves Egyptian food or wants to try something new and delicious.

On Thursday 8th February 2018 we moved to El Gezira Gardens Hotel. Due to the world Coronavirus pandemic we closed on Wednesday 19th March 2020. During early August we relocated back to El Gezira Hotel and opened up again on Saturday 8th August 2020 where we provide our daily specials board, a good selection of beers and wines and organise theme nights, live music and regular entertainment. description: Soho Square introduces a new and unique style of cuisine to Egypt The Caligula nightclub has been re-launched with a new entertainments concept. The hot rock dining and ballroom dancing! A piece of volcanic rock is heated for over several hours before being brought directly to your table. You then have the pleasure of being able to cook a dinner of your own choosing from a large and varied menu. Ancient cultures have been using this method for thousands of years, it is also very healthy as no oil or fat is used during the process, all the nutrients are sealed within. Hot rock dining is a very relaxed and sociable way to eat. There are no lengthy pauses in conversation when the plates of food are served and everybody "tucks in" as you cook the food at your own pace. This ensures that every last piece is hot and fresh. The whole method of dining becomes more leisurely and slower, where everybody tends to pause for conversation far more frequently. Only the freshet cuts of meat and fish are selected, you can choose from such sumptuous delights as Australian loin of lamb, black Angus beef ribs, Cajun salmon steaks, prawn and calamari skewers, plus much more.
name: Caligula Hot Rock
